title: Citywide Feedback Uprising
outcome: A transparency shockwave hits as BCI feedback and rationale for every citizen's score are suddenly made public. Outrage and alliances flare as neighborhoods, long kept isolated by hidden bias and algorithmic opacity, unite to form mass protests, demanding systemic change from a paralyzed Council facing real-time accountability.

events.description: BCI terminals citywide begin displaying live feedback for each citizen’s score—including reasons, disputed flags, and behavioral triggers. Crowds gather at display sites, reading scores aloud and questioning their fairness.

Neighborhood groups start forming to collectively challenge and contest BCI scores. Public reading forums appear, with citizens openly strategizing on how to repair reputations and support those unfairly flagged.

The Council, faced with mass unrest and direct feedback disputes, halts automated score enforcement in several zones, returning services temporarily to manual oversight. Opportunistic Council factions argue over the future of the BCI, while grassroots assemblies gain power.

Directorate loyalists attempt to restore BCI control, rerunning score updates, but citizens respond with a citywide stay-in-place demonstration, refusing to comply with orders until the full BCI mechanism is shut down and independently reviewed.
